summary: Manitoba is a Canadian province with a diverse landscape, from tundra to forests and grasslands. It's located in the center of Canada and has a population of over 1.3 million. Indigenous people have lived here for thousands of years. The area was once controlled by the Hudson's Bay Company and was home to many Indigenous and MÃ©tis settlements. Manitoba became a province in 1870 after negotiations and an armed conflict known as the Red River Rebellion. The capital, Winnipeg, is a major cultural and transportation hub, hosting festivals and sports teams.
title: Manitoba
